Text.val: @Created: 18-JUN-2008
@Author: AS (Andreas Sedlmeier)
Alternative for GB730 which uses external OS/400 commands to append files when
run on AS/400. This version uses Blobs and Blb2File(). Should be faster and shou
not (unlike GB730) run into trouble when there's very long lines in the file
02.05.2013 JH SCR18105 Removed external flag
15.10.2012 AS SCR#17463 fixed performance problems in the Java code
19.08.2012 AS SCR#17551 fixed problems with Unicode files (files with a BOM)
01-07-2008 AS, fixed problem with Blob (not set to NULL) (SCR# 13627)
18-JUN-2008 AS, initial revision, used for hotfix (SCR# 13627)
// 0:= no error occured (however, we do not check OS errors)
// 1 := input file not found
// 2 := output filename empty
There's a Magic special regardin 0 termination of Blobs which needs to be set to
N. Since it has not yet been tested if other programs using blobs behave well
then, the setting is change on the fly and set back to what it was before in TS
uniPaaS generates Problems if the files loaded into Blobs do hava a BOM. Even if the target
blob is defined to be Binary uniPaaS will remove the BOM and do a codepage conversion to Unicode
then. To avoid this, we remove the BOM
Convert Sourcefile -> UTF-8 without BOM
If there was a Unicode file (file with a BOM) involved we worked with UTF-8 files without a BOM.
The BOM we do set now
Basically the program will generate UTF-8 if at least one of the two files were Unicode
but if none of the two files was UTF-8 we choose a different character set
- the character set of the target - if it had a BOM
- the character set of the source if it had a BOM and the target had none

ExpSyntax.val: 'setting BOM of result to UTF-8: ' & Trim({0,2})
